title: Single website with three generation activities (text-to-image, text-to-video, image-to-video) using local demo generators

requirements.text: Create a single-page website that offers three distinct activities/tools: Text-to-Image, Text-to-Video, and Image-to-Video, with clear navigation (tabs or segmented control) to switch between them without leaving the page.

quotes: I want to single website different activities that's like a text to image image to video and takes to video

acceptanceCriteria: The landing view shows three selectable activities: Text-to-Image, Text-to-Video, Image-to-Video.
Switching activities preserves each activity’s form inputs until the user resets them.
All user-facing labels and helper text are in English.

requirements.text: Implement a Text-to-Image activity UI that accepts a prompt (text), basic style controls (at least: aspect ratio and a simple style selector), and generates a downloadable image result using an on-device/demo generator (no external AI services).
acceptanceCriteria: User can enter a prompt and click Generate to produce an image preview.
User can download the generated image (e.g., PNG).
If the prompt is empty, the UI prevents generation and shows an English validation message.
Generation runs locally in the browser (no third-party AI API calls).

requirements.text: Implement a Text-to-Video activity UI that accepts a prompt and simple motion controls (at least: duration and motion style) and generates a short downloadable demo video result locally in the browser (e.g., simple animated frames rendered to a video format supported by the browser).
acceptanceCriteria: User can enter a prompt and click Generate to produce a video preview element.
User can download the generated video.
If the prompt is empty, the UI prevents generation and shows an English validation message.
No third-party AI API calls are used for generation.

requirements.text: Implement an Image-to-Video activity UI that allows the user to upload an image, select simple animation controls (at least: duration and animation style), and generates a short downloadable demo video by animating the uploaded image locally in the browser.
acceptanceCriteria: User can upload an image and see a preview of the uploaded image.
User can click Generate to produce a video preview derived from the uploaded image.
If no image is uploaded, the UI prevents generation and shows an English validation message.
No third-party AI API calls are used for generation.

requirements.text: Add lightweight backend support (Motoko single-actor) to store a user’s generation history metadata (activity type, prompt, timestamps, and client-generated artifact identifiers/filenames) and expose query/update methods so the frontend can display a recent history list per signed-in user.
acceptanceCriteria: Backend provides methods to add a history entry and to list history entries for the authenticated user.
Frontend shows a 'Recent generations' panel listing at least: activity type, prompt (or a truncated version), and time.
History persists across page reloads for the same user identity.
No generated binary media is stored in the canister; only metadata is stored.

requirements.text: Provide a coherent visual theme for the whole site (colors, typography, spacing, and component styling) and apply it consistently across all three activities and the history panel (avoid a blue/purple color scheme).
acceptanceCriteria: All screens share a consistent theme (palette, type scale, spacing).
Primary/secondary actions have consistent styling across activities.
Theme does not rely on blue/purple as the dominant brand colors.

requirements.text: Add basic UX states for all generators: generating/in-progress state, success state with preview, and failure state with an English error message (e.g., if the browser cannot export a video).
acceptanceCriteria: Generate button shows a loading state and is disabled during generation.
Errors are shown in English and do not crash the page.
Success shows a preview plus a download action.

constraints: Backend must remain a single Motoko actor with all logic in the main actor file defined by the template (backend/main.mo).
Do not modify any frontend files under the immutablePaths listed in SYSTEM_CONTEXT; compose UI using those components/hooks instead.

Do not use third-party AI model APIs or external databases/services for generation or storage; generation must be a local/demo implementation in the browser, and persistence (if any) must use the canister for metadata only.
Use English for all user-facing text.
nonGoals: Implementing real AI text-to-image, text-to-video, or image-to-video using external model providers (e.g., OpenAI/Runway/etc.).
Storing large binary image/video artifacts in the canister.

required: Minimalistic three-icon set representing: text-to-image, text-to-video, image-to-video (tool-icons.dim_512x512.png)
Simple wordmark logo, monochrome, clean geometric style (logo.dim_512x256.png)
